The Arsenal Center for the Arts invites you to Text and ConText, a series by writers and artists about craft and the creative process. Upcoming Featured Guests are Lloyd Schwartz and Alex Alvear on Monday, March 24, 7:30 p.m. at The Arsenal Center for the Arts, 321 Arsenal Street, Watertown.

Each evening includes readings, conversations, and surprising links between the arts. After the presentations and discussion, refreshments will be served. Free parking.

Lloyd Schwartz is the author of three books of poetry: These People, Goodnight, Gracie and Cairo Traffic. He is the Frederick S. Troy Professor of English at the University of Massachusetts , Boston , the classical music editor of The Boston Phoenix, and a regular commentator for NPR. In 1994, he was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for Criticism. Most recently, Schwartz served as co-editor of Elizabeth Bishop:Poems, Prose, and Letters, for the Library of America. Alex Alvear is a composer, arranger, bassist, singer and Musical Director of Mango Blues, which incorporates elements of Jazz, R&B and Funk fused with traditional Afro-Latin music. Born in Ecuador , Alvear traveled to study at Berklee College of Music. He was a founder and the director of the group Ach√©, a pioneer of Afrocuban music in Boston .
